alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 5:12PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Natrona, southwestern Johnson and southeastern Washakie Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Cottonwood Pass, or 37 miles east of Shoshoni, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Natrona, southwestern Johnson and southeastern Washakie Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains
